message: Something essential or meaningful is happening
purpose: Renews energy; provides stability
Ignites creativity; connection; energizes

message: This is better than I expected!
purpose: Strengthens relationships; increases creativity; builds memories
Helps create relationships; community

message: This person or thing is safe
purpose: Helps to open up; connect; build alliances

message: I want to support the person or thing
purpose: Strengthens commitment to a person or idea
Helps to seek potential risks and not ignore the problem

message: Something I care about is at risk
purpose: Helps protect what we care about
Helps seek safety for self and others

message: I don't know what to prioritize
purpose: Helps to consider what to prioritize
Helps focus on the moment
Helps remember this moment
Helps remember people and things that are important
Helps focus on what is important to us
Helps to know what we truly want

message: This situation is not giving what it could
purpose: Helps to rest; learn and refocus

message: Something is wrong; rules are violated
purpose: Helps you notice something dangerous or wrong
Provides energy to block something vile
Allows to notice small problems
Can provide energy to overcome an obstacle

message: This situation is blocking me from something essential
purpose: Can help you confront an obstacle
Allows to pay attention and explore
Allows to look ahead and observe what might happen
Allows to prepare; observe carefully; stay alert

message: It is necessary to face an incoming threat
purpose: Helps prepare to react quickly to threats
combo-explanation: Anger means something is blocking us. Anticipation is about attention to the future. When combined we are driven to fight or break through the barrier.

purpose: Fosters option generation and motivates action
combo-explanation: Anticipation is about attention to the future. Joy is about things going well. When combined we look forward to what lies ahead.

purpose: Fosters respect for shared norms or rules
combo-explanation: Disgust signals a violation of norms or rules. Anger means something is blocking us. When combined we are driven to diminish or reject the perceived barrier.

message: A high-risk situation has appeared suddenly
purpose: Activates rapid threat response; preparing for immediate action
combo-explanation: Fear means something we care about is at risk. Surprise tells us something is unexpected. When combined we are shocked into defense.

message: There is a deep connection with one or more people
purpose: Creates a foundation of safety that fosters growth and development
combo-explanation: Joy is about things going well. Trust is a signal of safety and connection. When combined we feel deeply connected.

message: There is responsibility regarding something important
purpose: Fosters taking responsibility and encourages repair
combo-explanation: Sadness tells us we are losing someone/something we love. Disgust signals a violation of norms or rules. When combined for what we have done we feel the need to repair or improve.

message: An unpleasant or painful event has appeared suddenly
purpose: Helps focus attention on the problem or loss; mobilizing emotional resources to address it
combo-explanation: Surprise tells us something is unexpected. Sadness tells us we are losing someone/something we love. When combined we perceive that something external is wrong or bad.

message: Relying on this person or institution seems necessary to stay safe
purpose: Reduces perceived exposure to a larger threat by transferring control externally
combo-explanation: Trust is a signal of safety and connection. Fear means something we care about is at risk. When combined we seek protection.
